thread.title: RT - Daily news: NASA releases rare photo of Earth & Moon, as seen from Mars (PHOTO)
thread.title_full: RT - Daily news: NASA releases rare photo of Earth & Moon, as seen from Mars (PHOTO)

author: RT
title: RT - Daily news: NASA releases rare photo of Earth & Moon, as seen from Mars (PHOTO)
text:
NASA releases rare photo of Earth & Moon, as seen from Mars (PHOTO) Published time: 7 Jan, 2017 00:21 Get short URL Here is a view of Earth and its moon, as seen from Mars © NASA NASA have released a rare detailed photo of the Earth and the moon, as seen from Mars some 127 million miles (205 km) away. 
The photo is a combination of the best Earth image and the best moon image from four sets of pictures taken on November 20, 2016, by the High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment (HiRise) camera onboard the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter. Well, hello there! Earth and the Moon viewed from Mars, November 2016 – https://t.co/GAM6RP0xZf pic.twitter.com/gRUJtNj1Lj — HiRISE (NASA) (@HiRISE) January 6, 2017 
NASA admitted the moon was brightened significantly before compositing the image, as it is actually much darker and would be barely visible at the same brightness scale as Earth. 
However, the image does reflect “ the correct sizes and positions of the two bodies relative to each other ”. For scale, Earth’s could fit about 30 times in the distance between it and the moon. 
READ MORE: Breathtaking photos of Mars from deep space high-res camera 
In the image, Earth appears in shades of green, blue and red (due to vegetation). Australia is the reddish image in the middle of Earth, Southeast Asia is the reddish area near the top, and Antarctica is the bright section down the bottom-left. The other bright spots are clouds. 
HiRise and the five other instruments on the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter have been observing Mars since 2006.
